concept.title: Configure the Firewall
concept.shortdesc: This topic provides guidelines for restricting network access and managing iptables rules.

section.title: Reserved Ports
section.p: This section provides basic guidance on setting up a firewall around your Eucalyptus components. It is not intended to be exhaustive.
On CLC, Walrus, SC, and VB, allow for the following jGroups traffic:

ul.li: TCP connections between CLC, user-facing services (UFS), object storage gateway (OSG), Walrus SC, and VB on port 8779 (or the first available port in range 8779-8849)
UDP connections between CLC, UFS, OSG, Walrus, SC, and VB on port 7500
Multicast connections between CLC, Walrus, SC, and VB to IP 228.7.7.3 on UDP port 8773

section.p: On the CLC, allow the following connections:

ul.li: TCP connections for getting user credentials using euca_conf on 8080.
TCP connections for web services on 8773. This is used for external and internal communications by UFS and OSG.
TCP connections from CC and Eucalyptus instances (public IPs) on port 8773 (for metadata service)
TCP connections from Walrus, SC, and VB on port 8777
TCP and UDP connections for UFS and instance connections to DNS ports on 53.

section.p: On the CC, make sure that all firewall rules are compatible with the dynamic changes performed by Eucalyptus, described in the section below. Also allow the following connections:

ul.li: TCP connections from CLC on port 8774

section.p: On Walrus, allow the following connections:

ul.li: TCP connections from end-users on port 8773
TCP connections from SC, NC, and VB on port 8773
TCP connections from CC on port 8773, if CC image proxying is enabled

section.p: On the SC, allow the following connections:

ul.li: TCP connections from CLC, NC, and VB on TCP port 8773
TCP connections from NC on TCP port 3260, if tgt (iSCSI open source target) is used for EBS storage

section.p: On the VMware Broker, allow the following connections:

ul.li: TCP connections from CC on port 8773

section.p: On the NC, allow the following connections:

ul.li: TCP connections from CC on port 8775
TCP connections from other NCs on port 16514
Traffic forwarding to and from instances' private IP addresses

section.title: Restricting Network Access
section.p: This section provides basic guidance on setting up a firewall around your Eucalyptus components. It is not intended to be exhaustive.

section.title: Managing iptables Rules for the CC
section.p: In Managed and Managed (No VLAN) modes, Eucalyptus flushes the CC's iptables rules for both filter and nat, then it sets the default policy for the FORWARD chain in filter to DROP. At run time, the CC adds and removes rules from FORWARD as users add and remove ingress rules from their active security groups. In addition, the nat table is configured to allow VMs access to the external network using IP masquerading, and dynamically adds/removes rules in the nat table as users assign and unassign public IPs to VMs at instance boot or run-time.
